name: Julie's Bacon-Wrapped Turkey Meatballs
author: Jewelz
summary: Kids love this recipe and request it often. Is great for an appetizer or a main dish, in the oven or on the grill. Serve with barbecue sauce for dipping or they are delicious by themselves.
directions: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
Lightly spray a rimmed baking sheet with cooking spray
Cut each slice of bacon in half, crosswise
Mix together turkey, bread crumbs, egg, Worcestershire sauce, garlic powder, onion powder, pepper, and salt in a large bowl
Form mixture into 1-inch meatballs and wrap each meatball with bacon
Place on the prepared baking sheet making sure the bacon ends are tucked under the bottom of the meatballs
Cook in the preheated oven until meatballs are golden brown, about 20 minutes
Switch the oven to broil, and broil on high until bacon is browned, 3 to 5 minutes
